thread.title: Southwest Airlines flights in and out of Portland running on time after nationwide technical glitch
thread.title_full: Southwest Airlines flights in and out of Portland running on time after nationwide technical glitch | OregonLive.com

author: Stuart Tomlinson | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Southwest Airlines flights in and out of Portland running on time after nationwide technical glitch
text:
Flights in and of Portland International Airport on Southwest Airlines and other major carriers are not experiencing delays of more than 15 minutes, the Federal Aviation Administration website reports early Monday morning.
A technical glitch that caused massive delays on Southwest Airlines flights across the United States, including some in and out of Portland, on Sunday appears to be fixed.
The unexplained issue forced airline employees to check in some passengers manually, causing long lines across the nation. According to the airline, the ongoing problem caused more than 450 flights to be delayed.
Monday morning, websites that track delays and flight cancellations showed all Southwest Airlines flights were either on time or scheduled to depart at their regular times.
Southwest Airlines has been mum on the subject since its last update on Twitter Sunday afternoon where the company linked to statement saying travelers should arrive early, check-in online and print out boarding passes at home before arriving at the airport two hours early.
A story Monday morning in USA Today said that the issue had been fixed by 5 a.m. PDT, and that Southwest Airline flights in the Eastern U.S. were running mostly on-time.
-- Stuart Tomlinson
stomlinson@oregonian.com
